group_works.title: The Bat that cracked the frog code

results.title: The Bat that cracked the frog code
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife on One”.
Explores a dramatic breakthrough in the knowledge of animal behaviour. For the first time scientists have proved that vertebrate predator - fringe-lipped batrachops, (which inhabits the rain forest in Central America), can intercept the signals of another animal, the mud puddle frog, to identify and locate it as prey. Shows how the biologists went about obtaining their data.

results.title: The Bat whispers [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Roland West and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: An arch-criminal known as ‘The Bat’ who taunts police officers by providing clues about his upcoming crimes, terrorises the occupants of an isolated mansion during a raging thunderstorm. Though highly formulaic with all the narrative and iconographic cliches of the melodramatic haunted house genre such as rooms concealed behind swiveling fireplaces, subplots revolving around fragments of obscure treasure maps, shots, screams and faulty electric lighting, the film distinguishes itself through a succession of astonishing visual sequences. Director Roland West specially designed and constructed equipment and models that allowed the camera to exuberantly swoop, glide and zoom through space, hurtle down corridors and lurch from the tops of buildings. The stylised high-contrast expressionistic lighting is evocative of the German silent cinema which the director revered. One of the first films to be shot in widescreen (65mm ‘Magnifilm’), this version has been restored by the UCLA film archive. Nine years after the film’s release, the memory of its caped master-criminal inspired young comic-book artist Bob Kane to create a new superhero: Batman.

results.title: Birds of the Sun God. In Flight Movie
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife on One”.
Two films narrated by David Attenborough from the BBC Wildlife on one series. “Birds of the Sun God” tells the fascinating story of the partnership between hummingbirds and plants, a partnership which has lasted three million years. “In Flight Movie” uses remarkable new filming techniques to enable us to take to the air ourselves. This unique film enables you to fly in the clouds with a flock of geese, look over the shoulder of a soaring buzzard or hedge hop with a speeding starling, revealing just how a bird’s design is shaped to the life it leads - in flight! Issued as a BBC wildlife special.

results.title: Why the emu cannot fly
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Ken J. Widdowson, Educational Media Australia and Australian National University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Aboriginal legends”.
This film is illustrated by drawings of an Aboriginal legend from the book “Djugurba: tales from the Spirit Time” and tells how the emu’s vanity about his beautiful wings brings about his downfall.

results.title: The Bat and the rainbow
results.creator_credit: Educational Media Australia, David Corke, Ken J. Widdowson and Australian National University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Aboriginal legends”.
The Bat’s wife was stolen from him by Rainbow. To get her back Bat mortally wounds the sleeping Rainbow. Bleeding badly, Rainbow rolls into the waterhole where he can still be found. Occasionally, during wet weather, Rainbow rises from the waterhole and stretches his handsome body across the sky. This title is also available in a compilation with two other legends under the title “Aboriginal legends. No. 3” Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Balance
results.creator_credit: Karin Altman, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Louis Garneau is a road racing cyclist and an aspiring Canadian artist from Quebec. He pursues his cycling with the intensity that all top athletes must have, but he is also equally absorbed in his other interests: sculpture, painting and furniture making. Here is a very enjoyable story of an exceptional young man’s battle in a 185 kilometre road race.

results.title: Angela and Angella
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Angela Bailey and Angella Taylor are both ranked in the world’s top ten in the 100 metres sprint. They are fierce rivals and this film shows us the girls’ gruelling daily regimen, their attitudes to one another and to international competition. At the Commonwealth Games of 1982, we watch the way in which their coach handles their triumphs and failures

results.title: The Hurdle
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Douglas Sam, Australia’s best middleweight boxer, had to overcome enormous psychological pressures at the Commonwealth Games of 1982 in Brisbane. Douglas is an Australian First Nations man, and many of his people felt that he should not compete in these games. He did compete and the news media made Douglas a favourite for a gold medal. This film traces his wins and his losses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis O’Rourke, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
